title: Kai'Sa joins TFT in 9.19 and PBE now
body:
Class: Ranger & Assassin
Origin: Void
Ability: Kai’Sa dashes past the furthest enemy, gaining a shield and a lot of attack speed for a few seconds.
Cost: 5

The next champion to be added to Teamfight Tactics is none other than the daughter of the void, Kai’Sa. She’ll be warping in as a Legendary 5 cost unit and opening quite a few new build possibilities since she is a Void Assassin Ranger! A triple hitter to enable more unique builds. She can be the carry in an end game Ranger & Brawler build, or a safer Assassin while you chase the 9 Assassin dream. Lots of possibilities.

Kai’Sa’s base AD is lower, but she comes equipped with the highest base attack speed in the game. Perfect for stacking a Guinsoo’s or procing that Stattik Shiv as quick as possible in the end game. Her ultimate also allows her to jump around the map quickly and avoid dangerous situations. No longer are rangers locked into the corner!

Kai’Sa comes with an additional change to the Void trait. We’re happy with the true damage as a counter to strong defense, but it’s a little too easy to get it going in the early game with 3 low cost units. Because of this we’re shifting Void to work like Imperial.

(2): One of your Void units does true damage
(4): All of your Void units do true damage

This should allow void to not quite be so dominate early, but still be a viable option to scale into late game.

Look forward to Kai’Sa coming in patch 9.19, and give her a try on PBE today!
https://imgur.com/a/0PLKaTT

replies.body: Wait, she already dashes to the furthest enemies because of the Assassin trait and her ult then dashes to the furtherest, meaning she’ll go back to the frontline?

> [{quoted}](name=Sewer Side,realm=OCE,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=yE0xdABh,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2019-09-11T22:20:21.693+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=MaRiOnA,realm=EUNE,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=yE0xdABh,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2019-09-11T23:10:12.008+0000)
>
> very good point.. i wonder how it's gonna work 🤔🤔🤔

literally the same as pyke but with no stun following the path.
Having tried her, if she's in range to hit someone at the beginning of the fight she won't jump (similar to other Assassins, but more relevant in her case because *range*.)

Not necessarily! Assassins jump if no enemies are in their attack range at round start. If there is an enemy to engage, they aggro as normal. So, you can either position her way back so she jumps into the enemy backline, or set her farther forward to ensure she stays put and focuses the tanks with the rest of the team.
Its like rengar, they dash to the furthest enemy, so you might want to place your rengar/kaisa in a corner to make sure it can go from one side of the backline to the other side of back line
Assassins don't dash if they can target someone at the start of the combat. And because kaisa has big range, she wouldn't jump in most of the cases.
She will assassin dash first because she needs mana to activate her ability, then dashing to the furthest enemy. Now, if she starts with full mana, I'm not sure how it will turn out.
Will we be getting more units at the 1/2/3/4 cost slots as well?

There was no intention behind it, and there is a good chance that announcement was made in America, and the rioter had no idea kaisa was coming because she was made in Korea
I like this {{champion:145}}

Why "one unit at random" for the Void? Why not something like "deal half of their damage as true"? I hate the whole random unit... if a carry gets it you stomp, otherwise you're not doing much. The variance is just way too big.

It's meant as sort of either a nobles kind of situation, where it's just so strong early it's powerful enough on any of your units, or later on Cho/kaisa will work like draven/Swain where either of them could carry, but there is a distinct advantage on one of them.

> [{quoted}](name=sclom,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=yE0xdABh,comment-id=00090001,timestamp=2019-09-12T04:00:44.860+0000)
>
> It's meant as sort of either a nobles kind of situation, where it's just so strong early it's powerful enough on any of your units, or later on Cho/kaisa will work like draven/Swain where either of them could carry, but there is a distinct advantage on one of them.

And I'm not a fan of how Nobles or Imperial works with random units getting the buff. Especially considering how powerful the buff can be.

Even putting it at 50% true damage would make it incredibly strong early, which is expressly something they're trying to avoid — they _want_ the variance early to be high, so that it can be strong later.

> [{quoted}](name=Redesignated,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=yE0xdABh,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2019-09-11T22:49:50.609+0000)
>
> Even putting it at 50% true damage would make it incredibly strong early, which is expressly something they're trying to avoid — they _want_ the variance early to be high, so that it can be strong later.

Then not 50%. There is a number where it is balanced and not "random unit."
